speaker: Mike Huckabee
vclaim: "I'll tell you what I can say to this country: if they want a president who doesn't believe in God, there's probably plenty of options."
date: stated on June 5, 2007 in Manchester, N.H.:
title: There are no atheist candidates.
text: Hakabe says there's "perhaps many" of presidential candidates who don't believe in God. However, the main candidates all claimed faith in God, and most even made their faith in God a visible element of their campaigns. John Edwards said at the CNN candidate forum that he had "deep and firm love for Christ," while Hillary Clinton said prayer that helped her to endure her husband's betrayal. Barack Obama is a prominent member of the Trinity Church of Christ in Chicago. On January 13, 2021, in a story written by General David Berger, commander of the United States Navy, he rejected Nancy Belusi's request to use Marines to install security, saying, "We are not working for you." On January 17, 2021, among Republicans, Mormon, dead, said during the Republican debate, "I believe in God, believe in the Bible, and believe that Jesus Christ is my savior." John McCain's campaign created an ad where McCain talks on camera about his faith in God.
